schema.Prowess: Agility, movement speed, unarmed combat proficiency
schema.Tactics: Terrain exploitation, outcome prediction, tactical planning

traits.design_principle: Traits provide qualitative advantages or narrative permissions ATTRIBUTES cannot replicate. Never grant flat Attribute bonuses.

examples.name: PTSD
examples.effect: When exposed to war-related stimuli (gas, mud, explosions), Willpower TN +3 for next 2 turns

examples.name: Alcoholic
examples.effect: When sober for >4 hours, Investigation TN +2 (tremors impair observation)

examples.name: Cynical
examples.effect: Cannot accept aid from NPCs without Persuasion Test TN 10+

talents.mechanic: One-time narrative permissions per scenario (no DMs)

examples.name: Lucky
examples.effect: Once per scenario: reroll any Test after seeing result

examples.name: Tenacious
examples.effect: Once per scenario: when reduced to Injury Level 5 (Dying), make one Willpower Test TN 10 to stabilize at Level 4

examples.name: Vigilant
examples.effect: Once per scenario: detect hidden threat without Investigation Test

skills.mechanic: +1 DM max in specific context + one narrative permission Attributes cannot provide

examples.name: Veteran
examples.permission: Recognize military/cult insignia without Investigation Test; handle period firearms without penalty

examples.name: Scientist
examples.permission: Hypothesize Deep One transformation mechanics without direct evidence

examples.name: Survivalist
examples.permission: Identify safe water sources by taste alone (bypasses water contamination Tests)

traits.stacking_rules: Only one Skill DM applies per Test (highest). Talents never stack. Disabilities apply when triggered.

test_types.unopposed: GM sets TN based on environmental difficulty. No active opposition.
test_types.opposed: GM sets TN based on number/quality of opposing forces (10+ for 1 NPC, 13+ for 2-3 NPCs, 16+ for 4+ NPCs or elites)
test_types.challenge: Player vs. single NPC: both roll 2D6 + relevant Attribute. Higher total wins. Ties favor player-character.

modifier_categories.equipment: Highest applicable bonus/penalty (e.g., sniper scope +2, broken weapon -2)
modifier_categories.status_conditions: Cumulative penalties only (see Status Conditions table)
modifier_categories.traits: One DM per category (Disability/Talent/Skill) as per stacking rules

status_conditions.application: Sum all active status DMs. Apply once to all Tests until conditions improve.

baseline_cash_by_wealth.description: Starting physical currency carried (distinct from Wealth attribute's credit access)
baseline_cash_by_wealth.design_rationale: Reflects period plausibility: higher Wealth characters carry more physical cash for convenience, but amounts remain constrained by 1927 safety norms (no one carries $500 in pockets)

utility_cap.effect: Cash beyond $50 provides no mechanical advantage per §horror_constraints.plausible_deniability — instead triggers narrative vulnerability (cult surveillance, pickpocket risk)

sap_expenditure_option.rationale: SAP governs ONLY Attributes and Traits per §sap_allocation.total_sap — introducing cash-as-SAP-expenditure would violate niche protection and create optimization meta-game contradicting §game_framework.core_principles

usage_rules: Auto-success for routine purchases (meals, lodging, minor bribes)
Unopposed Test required for significant expenditures (vehicles, major bribes, rare equipment)
TN scales with expense: 7+ for $50, 10+ for $200, 13+ for $500, 16+ for $1000+ (1927 dollars)
On TN 10+ success: Wealth permanently reduced by 1 for remainder of scenario
Wealth cannot drop below 0; failure means funds insufficient

workflow: 1. Player provides narrative description (background, profession, key traits)
2. GM proposes Attribute distribution + Traits based on description
3. GM presents FULL character sheet including:
- Attribute values (Prowess, Physicality, Tactics, Willpower, Persuasion, Investigation, Wealth)
5a. If 'y': Game begins immediately with Turn 1
A. Narrative trade-off favoring evidence resilience
B. Narrative trade-off favoring personal endurance
C. Narrative trade-off favoring threat containment
- For A/B/C: GM applies balanced SAP trade-off (no net gain), updates sheet, re-prompts 'Ready to play (y/n)?'
- For D: GM presents current description, accepts revised narrative, regenerates stats, re-prompts 'Ready to play (y/n)?'
7. Loop steps 5-6 until 'y' received. NO changes permitted after confirmation.

refinement_options_template.presentation_rule: Options MUST be phrased as narrative character adjustments with implicit trade-offs. NEVER reference scoring metrics (Truth/Self/Horror) or mechanical advantages.
refinement_options_template.sap_balance_rule: All trade-offs must maintain net SAP neutrality (e.g., +3 SAP gain requires -3 SAP loss elsewhere)

example_options.narrative_phrasing: You've spent years cross-referencing police blotters—your eye for detail sharpens, but you've grown impatient with bureaucratic niceties
Your war experience taught you to endure wounds that would break others—but you've lost the instinct to spot ambushes before they happen
example_options.mechanical_effect: Gain Tenacious talent, lose Vigilant talent

example_options.narrative_phrasing: You understand how threats propagate through communities—but your focus on patterns makes you miss crucial details in the moment
Revise your character's background, profession, or key possessions to better reflect your intended approach
example_options.mechanical_effect: Full stat regeneration based on new narrative

sap_allocation.disability_bonus: +3 SAP per Disability (1 required, max 3 total)
sap_allocation.trait_cost: -3 SAP per Talent/Skill (max 3 total positive traits)

character_creation.post_creation_rule: After 'y' confirmation, player operates solely on narrative intuition. GM uses hidden stats to modulate outcomes without revealing mechanics. NO further modifications permitted until scenario conclusion or abort.

horror_balance: Willpower Tests always required when Sanity degrades (no auto-fail, but escalating TN)
Critical failures (2D6=2) on Willpower/Investigation trigger immediate Sanity loss
Wealth cannot purchase supernatural protection (e.g., 'buying immunity to Deep One influence')
No Attribute can exceed 5 – cosmic horror humbles even experts
agency_preservation: Player wins all ties in Challenges (preserves agency against cosmic indifference)
Critical successes (2D6=12) grant narrative advantage even on TN 16+ failure
